programme.desc: beIN SPORTS is the live and exclusive broadcast partners of Formula 1 until end of 2033 season. The 2025 season has a record schedule of 24 Formula 1 races and all race weekends, including every Practice, Qualifying, Sprint and Race will be live and exclusive on beIN.

programme.title: Arsenal vs. Manchester City - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Arsenal have won two of their last four league meetings with Manchester City, as many as their previous 22 beforehand. The Gunners could win back-to-back league games against the Citizens for the first time since December 2015. Manchester City have lost both of their last two Premier League visits to Arsenal, as many as their previous 14 beforehand. It’s their longest losing run away to the Gunners since April 2009.

programme.title: Manchester United vs. Chelsea - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Manchester United are unbeaten in their last 12 Premier League home games against Chelsea since a 0-1 defeat in May 2013. Indeed, Chelsea’s win rate of 18% at Old Trafford in the Premier League is their lowest away to any side they have visited 10+ times in the competition. After their 1-0 win in May, Chelsea are looking for successive league victories over Manchester United for the first time since winning three in a row from November 2009 to March 2011 under Carlo Ancelotti. The Blues’ two wins in their last three league games versus the Red Devils are as many as their previous 17 beforehand.

programme.title: Liverpool vs. Everton - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Liverpool have lost just one of their last 28 home games against Everton in all competitions, winning each of their last four in a row since a 0-2 defeat in February 2021. Only from February 1933 to January 1937 have the Reds ever won five straight home matches against the Toffees. Everton have won just two of their last 29 Premier League Merseyside derbies against Liverpool and have failed to score in five of their last seven.

programme.title: Crystal Palace vs. Liverpool - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Crystal Palace have won just one of their last 16 Premier League meetings with Liverpool, winning 1-0 at Anfield in April 2024. Liverpool have won nine and lost none of their last 10 away league games against Crystal Palace – this is their longest ongoing unbeaten run away from home in the league against any side.

programme.title: Nottingham Forest vs Sunderland -English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 6
programme.desc: This will be the first Premier League meeting between Nottingham Forest and Sunderland since the 1996-97 season, when the Tricky Trees lost 4-1 at home and drew 1-1 away that campaign. Sunderland have won five of their last seven league games against Nottingham Forest, with this their first since a 1-0 Championship victory in December 2017 under Chris Coleman.

programme.title: PSG vs Auxerre - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 6
programme.desc: Paris SG are the team Auxerre has played and lost against most often in Ligue 1. AJA have lost 10 of their 14 away matches against PSG in the top-flight in the 21st century. Despite having the same number of points and goal difference as Monaco, Paris SG is currently second in Ligue 1 2025/26. This is only the fourth time in the last 11 seasons that PSG are not in the lead after five matches played, after 2016/17, 2020/21 and 2023/24.

programme.title: Highlights - UEFA Europa League 2025/2026
Real Betis vs Nottingham Forest - UEFA Europa League 2025/2026 - MD1
programme.desc: This will be the first ever meeting between Real Betis and Nottingham Forest – the Spanish side have lost seven of nine previous European games against English teams, losing most recently in the 2025 UEFA Conference League final to Chelsea. In major European competition, Nottingham Forest’s only previous meeting with a Spanish club was in the Fairs Cup first round in 1961-62, losing 7-1 on aggregate to Valencia.

programme.desc: After their 4-1 win at St. James’ Park in January, Bournemouth could win back-to-back league meetings with Newcastle United for just the second time in their history, after November 2017. programme.title: My Faith in Sport - Sawm
programme.desc: Ramadan is a crucial period in the Islamic calendar but fasting (Sawm) can provide complications for athletes who are trying to compete at the highest level. But to what extent is fasting a negative or can it actually aid performance? We look at the life and adaptation throughout Ramadan of Adam Azim – an unbeaten professional boxer from the UK, Fares El Bakh – a weightlifter who won Qatar’s first ever Olympic gold medal, and Zainab Alema – a rugby player who is aiming to become the first player to represent England wearing a hijab. Experts in Sports Science and Nutrition from Aspetar Clinic, Qatar also add detail of the physical impact athletes encounter during Ramadan.

programme.title: My Faith in Sport - Salah
programme.desc: Exploring the importance of prayer within Islam, the episode begins with an overview of our seven athletes as they introduce themselves and why Islam is so important to them. We are also introduced to Omar Sulieman, a notable Imam, who acts as narration throughout the series and a guiding voice on the key principles of Islam. The life and career of Sofyan Amrabat is explored, showcasing his role as a key part of the Fenerbahce team in Turkey and the Moroccan national side. The Atlas Lions’ run to the semi-finals of the FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 is explored, with the impact that Salah played in the team’s belief and positivity throughout the tournament.

programme.title: Montpellier vs Chambery - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germains 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

programme.title: Al Rayyan vs Al Gharafa - Qatar Stars League 2025/26 - W6
programme.desc: The Qatari League is the official football league in Qatar. The league includes 12 teams. The most famous participating clubs are Al-Sadd, the champions of the last season; Al-Rayyan and Al-Arabi, the popular teams, Al-Duhail and Al-Gharafa, serious contenders for the title every season. The Qatari league includes star names such as Firmino, Verratti, and Qatari Akram Afif, the best player in Asia.

programme.title: History of the Asian Games
programme.desc: From its beginnings to today, the Asian Games torch lighting has become a dazzling showcase of creativity and technology. As the 2026 Games in Japan draw near, excitement builds over what new spectacle will capture the world’s imagination.

The most famous participating clubs are Al-Sadd, the champions of the last season; Al-Rayyan and Al-Arabi, the popular teams, Al-Duhail and Al-Gharafa, serious contenders for the title every season. The Qatari league includes star names such as Firmino, Verratti, and Qatari Akram Afif, the best player in Asia.

programme.title: HL - World series Triathlon - Dubai - Men’s Final
programme.desc: The worlds top ranked Olympic champions competed for the titles of the last round ( Dubai ) of the World Triathlon Diamond League in an exciting atmosphere over long distances, including a 2000m swim, 80km cycling and 18km non-stop running. It is worth noting that the total prize money for this round was two million dollars.

programme.title: Saint-Raphaël vs Tremblay - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germains 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

programme.title: Qatar Prix de lArc de Triomphe 2024 Highlight
programme.desc: The Qatar Arc de Triomphe Horse Racing Festival is considered one of the strongest races in the world, in which the most famous owners in the world, the best horses, the best trainers and the strongest riders participate. The horse Al Ghadeer was able to continue his successive victories, awaiting the crowning with the Triple Crown in the Emir of Qatar Sword in February 2025 after his victory in Qatar Goodwood and the Arc de Triomphe in Paris.
